sect1.title: A list of the different kinds of configuration

sect2.title: MXML Configuration
sect2.para: For Flex based applications the MXML configuration offers a familiar environment for populating the application context with object definitions.

To start an MXML configuration file create an MXML component that extends SASObjects and you can add components to it of type Object.<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <sas:SASObjects xmlns:fx="http://ns.adobe.com/mxml/2009" xmlns:s="library://ns.adobe.com/flex/spark" xmlns:mx="library://ns.adobe.com/flex/mx" xmlns:sas="http://www.springactionscript.org/mxml/config"> <fx:Script> <![CDATA[ import com.classes.MyClass; import com.classes.MyOtherClass; ]]> </fx:Script>
<sas:Object class="{MyClass}"/>
<sas:Object class="{MyOtherClass}"/>
</sas:SASObjects>
